meanings.sent1: The sponge was preabsorbing water before I even dipped it in.
meanings.sent2: The dry soil was preabsorbing the rain, preparing for the upcoming storm.
meanings.sent3: The preabsorbing towel was so thirsty, it drank up all the spilled juice in an instant.
meanings.sent4: Her preabsorbing mind soaked up knowledge like a sponge, always ready to learn.
meanings.sent5: The preabsorbing paper quickly soaked in the ink, leaving a permanent mark.

meanings.definition: Having the ability to absorb before something else.
meanings.sent1: The preabsorbing fabric prevented the spill from reaching the table.
meanings.sent2: The preabsorbing material in the diaper kept the baby dry all night.
meanings.sent3: The preabsorbing plant roots drank up the water before it could reach the other plants.
meanings.sent4: His preabsorbing knowledge of the subject made him the go-to person for advice.
meanings.sent5: The preabsorbing sponge soaked up the excess liquid, leaving the surface clean and dry.
